repository.corpname: Washington and Lee University, James G. Leyburn Library Special Collections and Archives

did.langmaterial: These materials are available in English.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials from Washington & Lee University's Special Collections are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study, pursuant to U.S. Copyright law. The user assumes full responsibility for any use of the materials, including but not limited to, infringement of copyright and publication rights of reproduced materials. Any materials used should be fully credited with the source. Permission for publication of this material, in part or in full, must be secured with the Head of Special Collections.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: This collection contains many photocopies. We believe the originals are owned by Duncan G. Groner.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation: [Identification of item], Duncan Green Campbell Papers, WLU Coll. 0063, Special Collections and Archives, James G. Leyburn Library, Washington and Lee University, Lexington, VA
In some cases the citation format may vary. Please contact Special Collections' staff to verify the appropriate format.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection includes correspondence concerning Campbell's negotations (1824-1825) as commissioner to the Creek Indians; a transcript of the proceedings and subsequent treaty of agreement relating to the removal of the Indians to points west of the Mississippi River; land deed of Archibald Campbell (d. 1820); and Campbell family genealogy.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research use.
